medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced two episodes of syncope, each lasting approximately 5 seconds, preceded by a few minutes of profound lightheadedness. During symptoms, a pulse rate of 40 bpm was noted despite a pacemaker programmed to VDD 60 bpm. Additionally, she reported new-onset dyspnea with exertion and progressive weakness in the lower extremities, which began 1 year prior and had progressed to difficulty in stair climbing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Long-standing history of palpitations; previous unsuccessful radiofrequency ablation for Wolf-Parkinson-White syndrome complicated by complete heart block necessitating dual-chamber pacemaker implantation. The patient had asymptomatic status for three years following pacemaker implantation until her current episode.
medical_history.family_history: Three healthy sisters; mother age 56 and well; father age 56 with Crohn's disease. Health history of grandparents is noncontributory.
medical_history.social_history: Works as a nurse. Not specified.
